definition: to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]

sentences.english: This research will increase our understanding of the economy in fiefs.
sentences.chinese: 这有助于扩大对春秋时期采邑经济的进一步认识。

sentences.english: Compurgation was used frequently in manorial courts.
sentences.chinese: 宣誓断案通常用于采邑法庭。

sentences.english: Feudal knights are given land, fiefs , in return for military service.
sentences.chinese: 封建骑士被授以土地和采邑，同时以军事服务为回报。

definition: grant of territory by an emperor or monarch (old)
feudal fiefdom/land held as a vassal in feudal society/enfeoffment
to divide and confer (property on one's descendants)
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor

feudal vassal/feudal princes, esp. the monarchs (dukes or princes) of the several vassal states 諸侯國|诸侯国 of Zhou during Western Zhou and Spring and Autumn periods 11th-5th century BC/subordinate warlord/local official
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
